item.title: Alice Springs Mayor Asta Hill tells of family tragedy that brought her back to home town
item.description: Asta Hill's grief over the tragic death of her younger brother 10 years ago is still raw, but the sad event is part of her story of connection to Alice Springs and hope for the outback town.

item.title: EPA investigates disturbing hum sound keeping north-west Sydney residents up at night
item.description: One sleepless resident said he drove around his local area to find the source of the disturbance.

item.title: Man accused of hitting 42yo with vehicle in Kalgoorlie appears in court
item.description: A 29-year-old man has faced court today after detectives from WA Police's Homicide Squad charged him with murder, two days after the death of a man in the state's Goldfields.

item.title: Siosifa Talakai says Cronulla Sharks players 'at each other's throats' before revival
item.description: Sharks star Siosifa Talakai gives an insight into the heated player meetings that came during Cronulla's mid-season slump before the team's spectacular charge to an NRL preliminary final.

item.title: ICC prosecutors charge Phillipines' former leader Duterte with crimes against humanity
item.description: Former president of the Philippines, Rodrigo Duterte, is accused of being involved in the murder of dozens of people.

item.title: Bill Gates pledges $US912 million to AIDS and malaria non-profit as US cuts funding
item.description: The tech entrepreneur's announcement follows deep cuts from governments around the world, led by the United States.

item.title: Man known as 'Moore Park Rapist' pleads guilty to series of sexual assaults in Sydney
item.description: Glenn Cameron has remained in custody since he was arrested in February last year and charged with more than 30 offences in relation to eight victims.

item.title: MS support agency MS Society SA & NT outlines three-year losses, $2.5m debt
item.description: Non-profit organisation MS Society SA & NT, says it has debts of about $2.5 million and has been facing losses for three years.

item.title: Why many Palestinians are underwhelmed by countries like Australia only now recognising statehood
item.description: Australia joined nine other nations in formally recognising Palestinian statehood at the UN this week. But Palestinians have mixed feelings.

item.title: Vanuatu plans to sign police deal with China while Nakamal pact with Australia is left hanging
item.description: Vanuatu declares it will sign a new policing agreement with China as the landmark Nakamal pact between Australia and the Pacific Island nation hangs in the balance.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs's lawyers pitch shorter prison term, therapy ahead of sentence
item.description: The disgraced hip-hop mogul is expected to be sentenced on October 3.

item.title: Optus triple-0 outage tragedy: What we know and how events unfolded
item.description: The first sign something was wrong came late on Friday afternoon. Now we have a clearer picture of how the triple-0 outage unfolded.

item.title: Victoria Police dog on the road to recovery after horror collision in Melbourne's north
item.description: A man has been charged following a collision in Tullamarine that left a police dog and his handler with injuries.

item.title: Thousands of bees swarm Wagga Wagga CBD
item.description: Thousands of bees appear without warning in the regional city, alarming locals and causing a commotion.

item.title: Melbourne Storm's Jahrome Hughes and Ryan Papenhuyzen return for NRL preliminary final against Cronulla
item.description: Melbourne recall three big guns, led by star half Jahrome Hughes, as their NRL title hopes go on the line in Friday night's preliminary final against Cronulla.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Super Typhoon Ragasa lashes Taiwan, with at least 15 dead and 152 missing
item.description: The most powerful storm so far in 2025 is now heading towards the Chinese mainland, prompting widespread disruption and warnings of sea surges.

item.title: Donald Trump uses United Nations speech to lay out the US's complaints with the world
item.description: Donald Trump uses a speech at the UN to criticise US allies' moves to recognise Palestine and chastise the international community over a range of other American grievances.

item.title: Russia systematically torturing Ukrainian civilians, UN says
item.description: The report is based on detailed interviews with 215 former detainees captured since Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

item.title: Incoming triple-0 reforms may not have helped prevent Optus failure
item.description: The federal government has yet to pass legislation to empower a new coordinator for the emergency services line, but experts say tougher conditions are needed on the telco itself.

item.title: Record number of calls to poisons hotlines for children ingesting melatonin
item.description: The ABC has analysed data from poisons hotlines across the country, revealing almost 1,500 calls were made about children taking melatonin last year, a dramatic rise on previous figures.

item.title: Could artificial intelligence and a universal basic income eliminate 'meaningless jobs'?
item.description: COVID showed just how "fragile" our economic security is. As artificial intelligence potentially takes jobs from humans, a universal basic income might be a solution.

item.title: Ryan Routh faces life in prison after guilty verdict in Donald Trump assassination attempt
item.description: A man accused of trying to assassinate Donald Trump at his Florida golf course last year has been found guilty on all charges.

item.title: Australians are moving to Tasmania to escape climate change, but the island state is not immune
item.description: Jack and Anna swapped the humidity of Queensland for chilly days in Tasmania, but is Tasmania really the climate refuge many think it is?

item.title: Holbrook Landcare wins Bob Hawke award
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Holbrook Landcare Network wins 2025 Bob Hawke Award
item.description: A landcare network at "the forefront of technology" has won the 2025 Bob Hawke Award for its innovative approach to sustainable farming practices.

item.title: How climate change impacted the 2025 snow season
item.description: The general sentiment is Australia's ski resorts are coming to the end of a bumper snow season — but is this evaluation accurate, or just positive spin after the dismal 2023 and 2024 seasons?

item.title: Dickie Bird, former English cricket umpire, dies aged 92
item.description: One of international cricket's most recognised umpires is being remembered for his "fairness, humour and love of the game".

item.title: Video record of violence and racism at Purnim Bears, Noorat country football grand final
item.description: The Purnim Bears were supposed to be the feel-good story of country football — a team uniting black and white communities. But their 1987 grand final was so violent it ended with their expulsion.

item.title: England names squad to face Australia in men's Ashes series 2025/26
item.description: England will bring a strong pace bowling attack, but several members of the squad, including captain Ben Stokes, are under injury clouds.

item.title: Ukraine can win back all territory lost to Russia, Trump says
item.description: The US president criticised Russia on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly, saying it had been fighting "aimlessly" in a war that a "real military power" would have won in less than a week.

item.title: Mal Lanyon chosen as next NSW Police Force commissioner
item.description: Deputy Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon has been chosen to head up the NSW Police Force, replacing commissioner Karen Webb.

item.title: Offshore wind pioneer Henrik Stiesdal says Australia can learn from Europe
item.description: A Danish clean energy pioneer says Australia is poised for success with offshore wind, but there are lessons it can learn from abroad.

item.title: Ange Postecoglou 'excited' to defend his Europa League trophy with Nottingham Forest
item.description: Four months after leading Tottenham Hotspur to Europa League triumph in Bilbao, Ange Postecoglou has returned to Spain and UEFA's second-tier club competition with a new challenge.

item.title: Unexplained lights in the sky sparks UAP chatter across much of Western Australia
item.description: Perth Observatory says it has received reports of lights dancing in the sky across a significant part of WA's Midwest and Goldfields, with an explanation yet to be found.

item.title: Queensland speed skydiver Natisha Dingle shows off her impressive skills.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Artemis program on track to take astronauts around the Moon: NASA
item.description: NASA's first crewed flight in its Artemis program — a trip around the Moon and back — is on track for launch in April 2026 and could potentially be moved up to February, the space agency says.

item.title: Trump claims paracetamol link to autism. Five experts explain what's wrong with that statement
item.description: Some leading Australian experts in medicine, autism research and obstetrics say the US president's claims are "a misreading of science," or at worst, "a misuse". Here's why.

item.title: Why the legacy of the 2023 NRL grand final hangs over the Broncos and Panthers
item.description: On Sunday, the Broncos and Panthers will face off in the finals for the first time since the 2023 grand final, but the memory of that night still hangs over both sides.

item.title: ABC ordered to pay $150,000 fine for unlawfully sacking journalist and presenter Antoinette Lattouf
item.description: The judge ordered ABC to pay a fine of $150,000 for unlawfully sacking journalist and presenter Antoinette Lattouf for reasons including her political opinions.

item.title: SA childcare centre ordered to temporarily close after claims children were left unsupervised
item.description: A childcare centre in Adelaide's inner south-west has been ordered to close for two weeks after being handed an emergency action notice following claims children were left unsupervised.

item.title: Bruce Lehrmann seeks funding to pay for legal representation over raids at his home in 2024
item.description: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann launches Federal Court action seeking funding for legal representation at a National Anti-Corruption Commission hearing after raids on his home in June last year.

item.title: Wallabies fullback Andrew Kellaway ruled out of first Bledisloe Cup Test match against All Blacks
item.description: Wallabies fullback Andrew Kellaway will miss Saturday's Bledisloe Cup Test match against the All Blacks in Auckland, ruled out with a calf strain.

item.title: Canberra golf course redevelopments providing both much-needed housing and financial lifelines for struggling clubs
item.description: With the ACT government pushing for greater urban density, golf courses in inner Canberra suburbs are becoming attractive sites for redevelopment to provide much-needed housing and a way for struggling clubs to bolster their budgets.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Camp Mystic plans to reopen next summer, a year after floods killed 27
item.description: Camp Mystic also announces plans for a memorial dedicated to "the lives of the campers and counsellors lost on July 4th".

item.title: Sculpture by the Sea could be cancelled due to $200,000 shortfall
item.description: Australia's famed sculpture walk is facing cancellation after failing to secure funding less than a month out from this year's event.

item.title: Man behind iconic ABC TV programs, Graham White, dies aged 93
item.description: Graham White was a pioneer of Australian radio and television and played a key role in the creation of numerous television series, including A Big Country.

item.title: Despite past controversy, NSW Police commissioner Mal Lanyon has a strong backing
item.description: For newly-announced Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon, Wednesday morning would have been both one of his proudest moments, and his most uncomfortable.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel returns, addressing Charlie Kirk and 'un-American' axing
item.description: Despite the late-night host's return, several US ABC affiliates did not air the episode, excluding an estimated one-quarter of American households.

item.title: Family suspects foul play in Noosa man Byron Dumschat's death in a Bali villa pool
item.description: An Australian family is asking why Indonesian police allowed three Australian witnesses to return home without being interviewed after their 23-year-old son died on the Indonesian holiday resort island.

item.title: Rape case against Bruce Lehrmann delayed after lawyer misses deadline
item.description: A judge says the process of a bid to stop a criminal rape case against former Liberal Party staffer Bruce Lehrmann proceeding has been "problematic" after his lawyer missed a key deadline.

item.title: How #RedundancyDiaries are busting the stigma of being let go
item.description: Camille says being made redundant was hard, so she began sharing her experiences on TikTok hoping to help others.

item.title: Donald Trump's changed stance on Ukraine could be a challenge for Vladimir Putin
item.description: If Donald Trump actually means what he has just said — that NATO countries have a right to shoot down any Russian jets in their airspace — the US president may be contracting out a serious counteroffensive against Russian aggression to NATO countries.

item.title: Report recommends gondola access to Jenolan Caves near the Blue Mountains
item.description: A report recommends building a gondola to the tune of $44 million to bypass catastrophic road failures that have long plagued the Jenolan Caves.

item.title: Elon Musk's father, Errol Musk, accused of abusing five of his children over three decades
item.description: Multiple police reports, social workers and family members uncover the allegations against 79-year-old Errol Musk.

item.title: Mount Isa man charged with more than 70 child sex offences
item.description: Police charge a 40-year-old man in Mount Isa and allege the offences occurred over 25 years.

item.title: Doctor who lost daughter to brain cancer receives grant in race to clinical trials
item.description: A professor who lost his daughter to brain cancer in 2018 is hopeful the research to find a cure in children is just five years away from clinical trials.

item.title: Optus to pay $100m fine, as crisis engulfing Australia's second biggest telco continues
item.description: In enforcing the fine today, the Federal Court's Justice Patrick O'Sullivan described the company's conduct as "extremely serious" and "appalling".

item.title: Concerns Launceston City Council could give away Birchalls CBD site it bought for $8.8m
item.description: Launceston City Council bought the historic Birchalls building for $8.8 million five years ago. A ratepayer association says it has learnt of a proposal to give it away "for nothing".

item.title: Kindergarten cleaner who allegedly filmed children in bathroom faces more charges
item.description: Prosecutors have flagged more potential charges for the Victorian kindergarten cleaner accused of secretly filming children in a bathroom.

item.title: Missouri woman gets more than four years jail for trying to sell off Elvis' Graceland property
item.description: A woman's attempt to sell off one of the most storied pieces of real estate in the US has come to naught. Here's how it happened.

item.title: Electric vehicle-to-grid trial in Exmouth generates promising results for state power distributor
item.description: State distributor Horizon Power says a trial of bi-directional charging with electric vehicles to both supplement the grid and take up excess power, known as V2G, has proved a success.

item.title: Christopher John Sullivan sentenced for stabbing partner Pauline Mountford in Gooseberry Hill
item.description: A 74-year-old man who slashed his partner's throat in their Perth Hills home is sentenced to 10 years in jail over the near-fatal attack.

item.title: Former A-League footballers Clayton Lewis and Kearyn Baccus sentenced over betting scam
item.description: Both players were paid $10,000 each to intentionally get themselves yellow cards while playing for Macarthur FC against Sydney FC to influence overseas bets on the game.

item.title: Thousands of Australians fighting 'cruel' battle for COVID vaccine injury compensation
item.description: Thousands of Australians who were injured by COVID vaccines say they are facing a 'cruel and complex' system to get compensation from the government.

item.title: Productivity Commission to review state and territory GST deal, including $60b WA windfall
item.description: Western Australia's GST deal, expected to cost the Commonwealth $60 billion by 2029, will form part of a review by the Australian Productivity Commission.

item.title: Former police officer Stephen Michael Calcutt pleads guilty to filming teenagers in shower and up skirt
item.description: The former sergeant also filmed up another teenager's skirt and had a number of cartoons depicting children in sexual situations on a hard drive.

item.title: Murder trial hears final arguments from trio accused of 2022 stabbing death of David Jenkins
item.description: The trial of two brothers and another man accused of the stabbing murder of a man in Tasmania's north in 2022 hears there is "no serious dispute" that Luke Shaw "was the person who killed" David Jenkins.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Senate inquiry examines federal environment department's SA algal bloom response
item.description: Officials from the federal environment department say they were not aware of the impact of SA's algal bloom until the state government contacted them in May, two months after the bloom was first detected. Speaking at a senate inquiry, department officials say the federal environment minister was not formally briefed on the bloom until July.

item.title: Alzheimer's drug Lecanemab approved by Therapeutic Goods Administration for use in Australia
item.description: The Therapeutic Goods Administration approves the drug Lecanemab, which can slow down cognitive decline in the early stages of Alzheimer's.

item.title: Italy sends navy frigate to assist Global Sumud Flotilla after vessels targeted by drones off Greece
item.description: The flotilla carrying aid and pro-Palestinian activists said they heard explosions and saw multiple drones that targeted some of their boats.

item.title: One dead in 'targeted' shooting at Dallas immigration centre, DHS says
item.description: Police were first alerted to the incident at 6:40am on Wednesday, local time, and later found the shooter on a nearby roof dead from an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound.

item.title: Kimmel monologue racks up millions of views on social media as Joe Rogan slams government 'dictating'
item.description: Kimmel's program was indefinitely suspended last week after he made comments about the late conservative commentator Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Australia's social media ban wins praise from Europe at UN event
item.description: Australia's willingness to take on the social media giants is drawing significant international interest, winning the support of the European Commission president at a forum in New York.

item.title: Australia in a 'dangerous place' as AI adoption ramps up, prompting calls to protect jobs
item.description: Artificial intelligence is coming for our jobs — but will it take them away, or just give us a powerful new assistant?

item.title: Will food prices ever come down? Don't bet on it
item.description: While recent cuts to interest rates may have given mortgage holders a bit of a financial breathing space, the cost of food continues to creep upwards.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Free speech pathologist sessions turning poor literacy rates around in Logan
item.description: A federal government backed weekly reading session led by experts is helping improve literacy rates in Queensland children.

item.title: Independent review launched into fire ant eradication program amid 'closing window of opportunity'
item.description: Authorities launch an independent review of Australia's national fire ant eradication program to evaluate the country's fight against one of the world’s most destructive pests.

item.title: Families demand inquiry into NSW Police handling of missing persons cases
item.description: Nikii Smith is one of 10,000 people who signed a petition calling for a NSW inquiry into the handling of missing persons cases.

item.title: China retains narrow edge over US as South-East Asia's most influential partner
item.description: New research shows that China retains a very narrow edge over the United States as South-East Asia's most influential partner, with experts predicting it will soon pull further ahead as the Trump administration's policies begin to bite.

item.title: Solar, batteries and the 'phone charger dilemma': How a standards gap threatens clean tech
item.description: In the same way Apple and Samsung used different phone chargers, many clean tech products are not compatible with others. Experts say it is a big problem for the energy transition.

item.title: Family calls for change amid frustration at seven-year coronial inquest wait
item.description: Robert Hall was killed when he was struck by partially blind driver John Charles Robertson on the Horrocks Highway in 2018. It has been a long wait for the family ahead of the release of coronial findings into his death next month.

item.title: Rodeo attendees told to practise safe sex as STIs continue to rise
item.description: Health providers in outback Queensland are taking a light-hearted approach to promoting safe sex, as new data shows sexually transmitted infections are on the rise.

item.title: Victim-survivors left to self-represent in Family Court of Australia proceedings due to legal fees
item.description: Jacinta says she is part of a "big wave" of litigants self-representing in Family Court of Australia proceedings after facing extraordinary fees from family law firms.

item.title: Elevated E. coli levels recorded at major NT crocodile farm owned by luxury label Hermès
item.description: One of Australia's largest crocodile farms, owned by a subsidiary of luxury label Hermès, is consistently irrigating with water containing E. coli concentrations almost 500 times the national guidelines.

item.title: Police launch fresh search of WA outback over Ray and Jennie Kehlet cold case
item.description: Detectives are this week revisiting the site in WA's outback where the body of prospector Ray Kehlet was found. His wife Jennie is still missing.

item.title: Indigenous teen speaks out against heckling of Welcome to Country
item.description: An Indigenous high school student's essay on the Anzac Day heckling of an Indigenous elder by far-right supremacists has earned her a nationally recognised award.

item.title: Magnitude-4.1 earthquake rattles Tasmania from Maydena to Hobart
item.description: Tasmania records a magnitude-4.1 earthquake in the state's south-west that was felt from Maydena to Hobart.

item.title: 'On guard' for share market correction, Optus debacle began in India — as it happened
item.description: Optus has now told the ABC the firewall upgrade that led to disrupted triple-0 calls was initiated in Chennai, India. Meanwhile veteran stockbroker Marcus Padley says he's "on guard" for a share market wipe-out.

item.title: Who is Samoa's new prime minister, Laaulialemalietoa Polataivao Fosi Schmidt?
item.description: Supporters are fervent in their enthusiasm for Samoa's new prime minister, but voters who are more sceptical of Laaulialemalietoa Polataivao Fosi Schmidt, question his motives.

item.title: Hundreds of new dust-related lung disease cases recorded in Queensland
item.description: Nearly 300 workers from mines and work sites have had cases of lung cancer, black lung and other illnesses recorded by the state's dust disease register in the space of 12 months.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy warns UN of 'the most destructive arms race in human history'
item.description: Ukraine's president calls for global action to regulate the twin threats posed by drone technology and artificial intelligence, warning "no-one can feel safe" from Russia's expansionist goals.

item.title: Macquarie to repay Shield investors after super platform failures
item.description: Macquarie commits to repaying thousands of Australians who invested hundreds of millions of their retirement savings in the collapsed Shield Master Fund amid admissions it contravened the Corporations Act.

item.title: China's President Xi Jinping announces new climate goal to cut emissions by 2035
item.description: Outlining China's new carbon targets in a video link to the UN climate conference in New York, President Xi Jinping says "green and low carbon transition is the trend of our time".

item.title: Katanning drivers fear the worst as untagged livestock roam roads
item.description: A Katanning school bus driver and local farmers are calling for urgent action to address a growing danger posed by wandering livestock on rural roads.

item.title: Nottingham Forest draws 2-2 with Real Betis in opening UEFA Europa League match
item.description: Nottingham Forest's long-awaited return to European competition ends 2-2 at Real Betis, with Igor Jesus's first-half double cancelling out by a late Antony strike.

item.title: Peter Tonagh to replace Catherine West as Nine's chair
item.description: He replaces Catherine West, who spent 18 months in the position.

item.title: Dramatic footage shows sinkhole swallowing up road in central Bangkok
item.description: Social media footage shows powerlines being pulled down into the 50-metre deep hole and vehicles teetering on the edge.

item.title: Man charged with multiple offences over pursuit, police say
item.description: South Australia Police says a Vale Park man has been charged following a pursuit that led STAR group officers and police negotiators to a unit in Adelaide's western suburbs.

item.title: Liberal candidate Gisele Kapterian abandons court challenge for Sydney seat of Bradfield
item.description: Gisele Kapterian abandons her court action challenging the election result in the federal Sydney seat of Bradfield.

item.title: Anthony Albanese addresses UN on climate goals, Gaza and Australia's security council bid
item.description: The prime minister uses his UN speech to talk up Australia's emissions plan after Donald Trump called climate change a "con job", and confirms Australia is still seeking a temporary seat on the body's security council.

item.title: Nicho Hynes shrugs off personal barbs ahead of NRL preliminary final between Melbourne and Cronulla
item.description: Accused by some of being too nice and not nice enough by others, polarising Cronulla star Nicho Hynes "doesn't give a rats" about criticism that comes his way anymore.

item.title: New head of Queensland's troubled DNA lab says backlog of testing could take years to clear
item.description: More than 170 rape kits caught up in the Forensic Science Queensland laboratory's backlog will be sent offshore next week for vital forensic testing, as the facility's new boss says it will take years to clear them.

item.title: Seasonal farm worker from Samoa pleads guilty to rape on Arrawarra beach
item.description: The 27-year-old worker from Samoa changed his plea after hearing the victim give evidence at trial.

item.title: Postal voting issues identified ahead of 2025 WA local government elections
item.description: Incorrect ballot papers are among several problems identified with postal voting packages sent out ahead next month's local government elections in WA.

item.title: Scott Selwood takes break from AFL after 'personally challenging year'
item.description: Scott Selwood will take time away from football, stepping down as an assistant coach with Collingwood, following a year marked by personal tragedy.

item.title: AI image recognition technology used to detect traffic offences raises privacy concerns, Queensland audit finds
item.description: Queensland's transport department uses AI in its cameras to detect mobile and seatbelt offences, but a new audit has ordered called for a review into how that's done.

item.title: What are Australia's chances of returning to the UN Security Council?
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese makes a fresh push for Australia to get a seat on the United Nations Security Council in 2029-30.

item.title: Snoop Dogg says AFL grand final is 'a way of life' ahead of headline show
item.description: Snoop Dogg has strutted into the MCG for his official appearance ahead of a fascinating, somewhat controversial, AFL grand-final entertainment set.

item.title: Denmark PM apologises to indigenous Greenlanders who faced forced contraception
item.description: The apology by Mette Frederiksen in Greenland’s capital, Nuuk, hopes to close a traumatic chapter in Greenland's history.

item.title: Forestry industry says it can meet demand for biofuels as climate targets near
item.description: With biofuels earmarked as a way to power the transport sector in the future, one industry says its waste can be converted into aviation and shipping fuel.

item.title: Violent man abandons appeal to avoid jail for assaulting teenage ex-girlfriend
item.description: A 19-year-old Victorian man, who recorded 67 prior convictions for stalking and breaching family violence orders against his young ex-girlfriend, has failed in a bid to stay out of jail.

item.title: Perth grandmother Donna Nelson loses appeal over Japan drug smuggling conviction
item.description: Convicted drug smuggler and Perth grandmother, Donna Nelson, loses her appeal against her conviction for smuggling two kilograms of methamphetamine into Tokyo Airport.

item.title: Trio of space weather satellites launched to study the Sun's violent side
item.description: NASA successfully launches multiple satellites designed to get a better understanding of the Sun's influence on Earth.

item.title: TGA approves new brain stimulation device for treatment of depression
item.description: Some international users of Flow Neuroscience's device have labelled the wearable tech as a game-changer in treating depression, but not everyone is convinced.

item.title: Key takeaways from day two at the UN General Assembly's world leaders week
item.description: The world's most powerful people are meeting in New York this week. Here are the key takeaways from the UN summit's second day.

item.title: Wallabies vs All Blacks Bledisloe Cup: Team lists, what time is kick-off? How can I watch?
item.description: Wallabies prop James Slipper will notch an important milestone against New Zealand on Saturday, while James O'Connor will start at fly half.

item.title: South Australia passes laws to protect victims of personal injury from 'claim farmers'
item.description: Individuals who contact a survivor of abuse or personal injury without their permission to encourage them to make a claim for compensation could face fines of up to $50,000 under new laws which have passed in South Australia.

item.title: Hastie lets loose, one-on-one with Albanese and Trump, and the politics of Palestinian recognition
item.description: It turns out that Prime Minister Anthony Albanese didn't need a can of Diet Coke and a cheeseburger to attracted the US president's attention.

item.title: Celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright set to appeal guilty verdict on five grounds
item.description: Matt Wright’s lawyers have confirmed they will file a notice of appeal within the next 48 hours, indicating it will be based on five different grounds.

item.title: Ahead of the biggest game of his NRL career, Nicho Hynes returns to where it all began
item.description: Ten years to the day since his first moment in the spotlight, Nicho Hynes returns to AAMI Park for the most important game of his NRL career.

item.title: SA government grapples with whether it should issue daily bloom updates during summer
item.description: South Australia's Premier says the government is grappling with whether it should give daily updates on the bloom's location during summer, and says it has been "actively engaged" in conversations with the federal government since its emergence.

item.title: Queensland police to receive 8 per cent pay rise over three years after accepting pay offer
item.description: Queensland police officers will receive a wage increase, retention incentive and new allowances after accepting a pay deal from the state government.

item.title: Firefighters race to set hazard reduction burns across Greater Sydney ahead of fire season
item.description: Sydney's wettest August on record has dampened efforts by fire authorities to meet hazard reduction burn targets.

item.title: Liberal veteran Amanda Vanstone chides Andrew Hastie for not being a team player, warns of runaway ego
item.description: A doyenne of the Liberal Party and veteran of leadership battles dating back to the 1980s Howard–Peacock era has chided Andrew Hastie for not being a team player.

item.title: Matildas strike force could benefit from having both Sam Kerr and Michelle Heyman firing fit up front
item.description: A fit-again Sam Kerr doesn't necessarily spell the end for Michelle Heyman's time in the Matildas, if anything the A-League star can't wait for her return.

item.title: SA Water fined $60k for causing 'environmental harm' during botched maintenance of Warren Reservoir
item.description: SA Water — which is owned by the SA government — has been fined for polluting the waterways with grey clay silt when draining the Warren Reservoir, in the Barossa Valley, in May 2023.

item.title: Lachie Neale and Rhys Stanley named in AFL grand final teams as Jarrod Berry fails to recover from shoulder injury
item.description: Brisbane's co-captain returns just weeks after doctors gave him as little as a five per cent chance of featuring in his third straight grand final as Geelong welcomes back a familiar face to take the place of Tom Stewart.

item.title: Adelaide 36ers terminate Montrezl Harrell's contract amid China doping case
item.description: The Adelaide 36ers terminate Montrezl Harrell's contract while he serves a provisional ban after testing positive for an illicit substance.

item.title: Measles case detected in Brisbane, prompting calls for vaccination
item.description: Queensland's health department says the person was believed to have contracted the virus in Bali, before visiting a number of businesses across Brisbane and the Sunshine Coast.

item.title: Lawyers for Raiders star Josh Papalii ask court to discontinue charges over police group chat
item.description: The Raiders star's lawyers are asking the ACT Magistrates Court to discontinue charges against him over a 2024 incident.

item.title: Horse trainer Dwayne Schmidt jailed for raping and impregnating 13yo girl
item.description: New South Wales horse trainer Dwayne Schmidt is sentenced to more than three years in jail for raping and impregnating a 13-year-old girl.

item.title: Gympie Regional Council votes to remove fluoride from town's water supply
item.description: Gympie scraps fluoride from its water supply and becomes the third region in Queensland to reject the practice in just over a year.

item.title: Coroner finds Monash Health provided unreasonable care before toddler Dio Kemp's death
item.description: Three-year-old Dio Kemp was taken to Monash Medical Centre four times over 10 days before she died of sepsis.

item.title: Mass puffer fish deaths and red-bell jellyfish bloom put Pilbara coast on alert
item.description: Hundreds of dead puffer fish are found on a Pilbara beach, as an epic red-bell jellyfish bloom prompts a warning from the region's ports authority.

item.title: Arts industry leaders call for tax reforms to help struggling sector
item.description: Arts industry leaders say creative tax form is needed to create greater opportunities for Australian artists.

item.title: All the latest finance news
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: How old is too old to drive?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: AFL Final – The Cats, the Lions and Snoop Dogg
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Denmark's defence minister says 'professional actor' behind drone flights over airports
item.description: The drone flights occurred over several airports across the country throughout the week.

item.title: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy found guilty of criminal conspiracy in case linked to Muammar Gaddafi
item.description: Nicolas Sarkozy is found guilty of obtaining millions of euros in illegal financing from late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi for his successful 2007 presidential bid.

item.title: Jerry Robertson found guilty of murdering partner with sledgehammer in Alice Springs
item.description: An NT Supreme Court jury finds an Alice Springs man guilty of murdering his female partner in July 2023.

item.title: Top stories from ABC News
item.description: Listen to ABC News interviews and commentary and analysis from radio programs like AM, PM and The World Today.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he will step down as president after Ukraine war ends
item.description: Ukraine's president has been in office since 2019, with elections slated for last year suspended by martial law as a result of Russia's ongoing invasion.

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs seeks to appeal to prostitution conviction
item.description: The former hip-hop mogul was found guilty by a jury on prostitution charges but cleared him of the more serious counts of sex trafficking and racketeering.

item.title: Amazon fined $3.8b for misleading American Prime subscribers
item.description: Around 35 million US Prime customers, equivalent to one in 10 American citizens, will be eligible for a payout.

item.title: Out-of-pocket costs, eroding trust contributing to decline in childhood vaccination rates, new report finds
item.description: A new report finds out-of-pocket costs and eroding trust are contributing to a "concerning" decline in childhood vaccination rates.

item.title: China's 'soft' 2035 climate target frustrates experts amid rapid renewable growth
item.description: China baffles climate experts by setting the bar low with its 2035 emissions reduction target amid speculation the renewables superpower will most likely exceed its ambitions.

item.title: GIM Trading used virtual office space to create veneer of legitimacy as it allegedly defrauded millions
item.description: GIM Trading has been accused of defrauding Aussie investors out of millions of dollars. Financial investigators say the company created a veneer of legitimacy and evidence suggested overseas criminals could be involved.

item.title: China aid and investment returns to Solomon Islands's Malaita province after ban
item.description: The Solomon Islands's province of Malaita made global headlines five years ago when it banned Chinese investment. But today, a new China-funded road project is on the way — and the people are all for it.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: A viral Donald Trump moment, a retracted study and daylight saving time
item.description: It's that time of the week again. Test your news knowledge to see how much you remember for the week that was.

item.title: Imported potatoes threaten Tasmanian growers, as companies look for cost savings overseas
item.description: Cheap potato imports from India and China are threatening the livelihoods of Tasmanian growers, as stalled negotiations with potato giant Simplot leave some farmers about to plant this year's crop without a contract.

item.title: 2025 AFL season quiz: Twenty questions before the AFL grand final
item.description: There are just four quarters of footy left in the 2025 men's AFL season, so now is as good a time as any to see how much you remember about the year just gone with our quiz.

item.title: Police search for alleged Porepunkah gunman Dezi Freeman hits one-month mark
item.description: A month into the high country search for alleged Porepunkah gunman Dezi Freeman, a former detective says Victoria Police can not realistically expect to continue the manhunt indefinitely.

item.title: AFL popularity growth fuels calls to move the Barassi Line separating codes
item.description: Initially laughed off, these pioneers from Victoria were determined to challenge Australia's sporting status quo, and their legacy continues today.

item.title: Tania's parents took her to Russia, where she says they were 'brainwashed'
item.description: Years of fighting have created a crisis among Ukrainian children, with thousands estimated to have been transferred to Russia, where some are placed in so-called "re-education camps".

item.title: Southern rock lobster prices finally bounce back amid demand from China
item.description: After years of export trade disruptions, southern Australian rock lobster commercial fishers are hauling in catches that will fetch up to $125 per kilogram.

item.title: Teacher and librarian facing animal cruelty charges lose fight against ban from working with children
item.description: A teacher and a librarian banned from working with children after they were charged with ill-treating animals have lost a bid to have the ban rescinded.

item.title: Federal politics live: Albanese–Trump meeting not linked to AUKUS review: Marles
item.description: Anthony Albanese's planned meeting with the US president has "absolutely" no link to the expected finalisation of the Trump administration's review into the AUKUS security pact, Richard Marles says. Follow live.

item.title: Dallas authorities give update on shooting at ICE facility
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Trump says 'radical left' is fuelling violence against ICE
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: FBI finds notes by ICE shooter saying he wanted to target agents, not detainees
item.description: The FBI has searched the home of the man who opened fired on an Immigration and Customs Enforcement facility in Texas, finding notes that say he was acting alone and intended to target agents, not detainees.

item.title: Illawarra groups want Port Kembla ruled out for AUKUS nuclear submarine base
item.description: The federal government says it will not make a decision on the location of the nuclear submarine base until later this decade, but Illawarra institutions — from unions to churches — are sending a strong message now.

item.title: Live updates: CSL falls on Trump's 100pc tariffs on pharmaceuticals from October while ASX edges lower
item.description: US President Donald Trump has announced 100 per cent tariffs on pharmaceutical imports from October. Meanwhile, the ASX has nudged lower at the open with CSL falling by three per cent. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Robert Carlyle on the hacking scandal that brought down a Murdoch paper
item.description: Robert Carlyle plays an integral role in The Hack, co-starring David Tennant, which digs deep into the News of the World phone-hacking scandal.

item.title: Bondi's Sculpture by the Sea offered $200,000 lifeline after financial woes
item.description: Sculpture by the Sea was facing cancellation with organisers forced to make an urgent public plea for last-minute funding.

item.title: WA government accused of treating Port Hedland's water supply like 'lolly shop'
item.description: An Indigenous elder says the rapid depletion of Port Hedland's groundwater stores has been evident for decades, but the government has prioritised mining interests over people.

item.title: 'I am innocent,' says former FBI director James Comey after being indicted on two counts
item.description: He was indicted on one count of making false statements and one count of obstruction of justice.

item.title: Hong Kong and southern China reopen after powerful Typhoon Ragasa
item.description: Hong Kong and cities in China's Guangdong province have reopened businesses and schools after the world's most powerful tropical cyclone this year.

item.title: Encouraging more people to learn Auslan
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Connecting with Auslan in Deaf spaces
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: International Week of Deaf People marked in unique Deaf spaces where Auslan is celebrated
item.description: Access to language is essential for the Deaf community, but it isn't always guaranteed — especially in isolated parts of Australia. Locals are advocating for more awareness and support this International Week of Deaf People.

item.title: Security council bid 'important': Richard Marles
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Hiker with motor neurone disease takes on WA's 1,000km Bibbulmun Track
item.description: One week into her 1,000-kilometre trek of WA's Bibbulmun Track, 70-year-old Catherine Perversi says "the stillness is sublime" — and she would not be anywhere else.

item.title: Barassi line divide
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Trump has signed an executive order on TikTok. What does that mean?
item.description: Donald Trump has signed an executive order that he says will allay security concerns regarding Chinese influence on social media platform TikTok.

item.title: Foster carer shortage in WA's Kimberley forces children away from country
item.description: A shortage of foster carers in regional WA is pushing vulnerable children, especially First Nations kids, thousands of kilometres from their families, culture and country.

item.title: Donald Trump imposes 100 per cent tariffs on branded pharmaceuticals
item.description: The United States will impose a 100 per cent tariff on imports of branded or patented pharmaceutical products from October 1, unless a pharmaceutical company is building a manufacturing plant in the US.

item.title: Freight train derails after collision with sheep truck at Bribbaree
item.description: A freight train derails following a crash with a truck carrying livestock in central west New South Wales.

item.title: Beleaguered Townsville mayor Troy Thompson resigns, vows to run again
item.description: A Queensland mayor under investigation for misrepresenting his military, education and business credentials has announced his resignation.

item.title: Scientist wins peace prize for farmer-managed natural regeneration work
item.description: A Victorian scientist whose farming technique has revolutionised agriculture in Niger has been awarded an international peace prize.

item.title: Newcastle Ocean Baths the setting for new headphone theatre production, Meet Me at the Baths
item.description: A new headphone theatre production is set among the swimmers and sunbakers at a NSW city's much-loved ocean pool.

item.title: Health minister concedes tobacco black market has 'exploded'
item.description: Health Minister Mark Butler admits black market tobacco is now the single biggest threat to public health.

item.title: AFL grand final preview — how Geelong's unpredictable set up and late term heroics have set them up for a flag
item.description: From an innovative ruck set up to an uncanny ability to play out the quarter, the perennially competitive Cats are knocking on the door of another flag.

item.title: Branxholme Wallacedale Saints under 11s celebrate a win
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Branxholme Wallacedale Saints focus on club culture to become family-friendly
item.description: The Branxholme Wallacedale Saints have worked tirelessly to improve their once-troubled reputation so families and their kids want to play there.

item.title: Brisbane Broncos face Penrith Panthers in preliminary final without key forward Pat Carrigan
item.description: Brisbane's forward pack is on notice to do their jobs and a bit more against Penrith in the preliminary final to cover the absence of Pat Carrigan.

item.title: Brisbane hellbent on ending horror NRLW finals run ahead of preliminary final clash with Newcastle
item.description: The Broncos have been almost untouchable through the 2025 NRLW season but the club's poor finals record in recent years means they can not afford to get ahead of themselves leading into this week's preliminary final.

item.title: Daytime clubbing grows in popularity as dance venues cater to older patrons
item.description: Around Australia, over-30s are hitting the dance floor in daylight hours as more venues offer "soft clubbing" opportunities.

item.title: TASC 'confident' Tasmanian school exams are ready after report finds 11 errors last year
item.description: An independent report into Tasmania's senior school exams blames understaffing for a series of mistakes found in last year's exam papers, with the body responsible saying "safeguards" are in place for this year.

item.title: Australian doctors become unofficial correspondents from hospital in Gaza City
item.description: In a ruined hospital and with little medication, two Australian doctors say the situation inside Gaza City is a "nightmare".

item.title: AFL grand final preview — how corridor control and the hard ball can lead Brisbane to back-to-back
item.description: They've had to deal with adversity all year, but the Lions are one step away from historic back-to-back flags — here's how they can do it.

item.title: A Qantas flight from Sydney lands safely at Auckland Airport after mayday call
item.description: The pilot requested an emergency landing after receiving indications about a potential fire in the cargo hold.

item.title: Marion, Burnside and West Lakes among shopping centres listed by SA Police as Declared Public Precincts
item.description: SA Police has announced Declared Public Precincts at eight shopping centres in metropolitan Adelaide, which will allow police to search people and remove them from the site.
